data: Verify that an 'Admit to' Order has been entered prior to completing the PowerPlan (NOT required for direct admit patients)
The MHA Form 4 PowerPlans will notify nursing and SW of the need to complete and track the appropriate MHA Forms and activate a form expiry alert
Nursing to help verify completion of all relevant forms
On admission, qdaily for three days, then qweekly
On admission, qdaily for three days, then qweekly

See link for Mental Health Programs: Level of Observation
-CAPE/Child: q15min while awake and q30min when asleep
-Adolescent/Eating Disorders: q30min while awake and q1h when asleep
While awake, within arms reach and always within sight
While asleep, within arms reach and always within sight
While in bathroom, always within sight
While in bathroom, within arms reach and always within sight
Accompanied, May accompany staff off unit at nurse discretion. Nurse to dispense all scheduled medications for the length of the pass
Accompanied, 1-4 hours per day off unit with caregivers at nurse discretion. Nurse to dispense all scheduled medications for the length of the pass
Accompanied, 1-4 hours per day off unit with caregivers at nurse discretion. Patient to use own medication supply while out on pass
Accompanied, Overnight pass at nurse discretion. Patient to use own medication supply while out on pass
Accompanied, Overnight pass at nurse discretion. Patient to use hospital supply while out on pass - see medication list for pass
Review the most current diet order for therapeutic requirements, food texture and fluid thickness. Add anything to be carried forward to the new Diet Order
Age: 4-8 years, Texture: Regular and Easy to Chew 7
Age: 9-13 years, Texture: Regular and Easy to Chew 7
Age: 14-18 years, Texture: Regular and Easy to Chew 7
Reason for Consult: Disordered Eating Pattern
Reason for Consult: Inadequate Oral Intake
Reason for Consult: Inapprop for age/stage feeding behavior
Reason for Consult: Other (specify in Special Instructions), Excessive weight gain
Urinalysis Macroscopic (dipstick) with Microscopic if indicated
Urine, Midstream, Routine, Collection: T;N, once
Urine, Midstream, Routine, Collection: T;N, once
Routine, Scheduling Priority: Within 1 Week, Reason For Exam: Baseline/to rule out seizure, Schedule as: Inpatient
Routine, Reason: Other (please specify), Baseline/to monitor medication side effects
Routine, Schedule as: Inpatient, Reason For Exam: To rule out sleep apnea, Scheduling Priority: Within 1 Week, Scheduling Location: BCH Sleep Lab
Consider consulting directly (e.g. via telephone) with: General Pediatrics, Medical Genetics, Metabolic Program, Neurology, and Nurse Practitioner
Nurse to initiate the Laboratory phase of this powerplan within 1 week of patient's admission
